title: Error when I tried to compile my code???

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.

http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/

-->

### Code

```Rust
use image::{ImageBuffer, RgbaImage};
use std::time::Instant;

const ITERATIONS: i32 = 100;

//A function that takes 4 coordinates and a color as input and draws a line
fn drawline(coordinates0: (i32, i32), coordinates1: (i32, i32), x0: i32, y0: i32, x1: i32, y1: i32, canvas: &mut RgbaImage, color: &[u8; 4]) {
    let steep: bool = false;
    //If the change across the y axis is greater than that of the x axis, then swap their roles
    if (coordinates0.0-coordinates1.0).abs()<(coordinates0.1-coordinates1.1).abs() {
        coordinates0 = (coordinates0.1, coordinates0.0);
        coordinates1 = (coordinates1.1, coordinates1.0);
        steep = true;
    }
    if coordinates0.0 > coordinates1.0 {
        (x0, y0) = coordinates0;
        (x1, y1) = coordinates1;
        coordinates0 = (x1, y0);
        coordinates1 = (x0, y1);
    }
    for x in coordinates0.0..coordinates1.0 {
        let t: f32 = (x-coordinates0.0) as f32/(coordinates1.0-coordinates0.0) as f32;
        let y: u32 = (coordinates0.1 as f32*(1.-t) + coordinates1.1 as f32*t).round() as u32;
        if steep {
            *canvas.get_pixel_mut(y, x as u32) = image::Rgba(*color);
        } else {
            *canvas.get_pixel_mut(x as u32, y) = image::Rgba(*color);
        }
    }
}

//A function that takes 4 coordinates and a color as input and draws a line
fn line(arr: (i32, i32, i32, i32, bool), canvas: &mut RgbaImage, color: [u8; 4]) {
    for x in arr.0..arr.2 {
        let t: f32 = (x-arr.0) as f32/(arr.2-arr.0) as f32;
        let y: u32 = (arr.1 as f32*(1.-t) + arr.3 as f32*t).round() as u32;
        if arr.4 {
            *canvas.get_pixel_mut(y, x as u32) = image::Rgba(color);
        } else {
            *canvas.get_pixel_mut(x as u32, y) = image::Rgba(color);
        }
    }
}

//A function that reverses the coordinates as seen fit in order to execute the function correctly
fn lineref(x0: i32, y0: i32, x1: i32, y1: i32) -> (i32, i32, i32, i32, bool) {
    let mut steep = false;
    if (x0-x1).abs()<(y0-y1).abs() {
        steep = true;
        if y0>y1 {
            (y1, x1, y0, x0, steep)
        } else {
            (y0, x0, y1, x1, steep)
        }
    } else {
        if x0>x1 {
            (x1, y1, x0, y0, steep)
        } else {
            (x0, y0, x1, y1, steep)
        }
    }
}



fn main() {
    let white: [u8; 4] = [255,255,255,255];
    let red: [u8; 4] = [255,0,0,255];
    
    let mut canvas: RgbaImage = ImageBuffer::new(100, 100);

    let time = Instant::now();

    for _i in 0..ITERATIONS {
        drawline((13, 20), (80, 40), &mut canvas, &white);
        drawline((20, 13), (40, 80), &mut canvas, &red);
        drawline((80, 40), (13, 20), &mut canvas, &red);
    }

    println!("Time elapsed lines: {:?}", time.elapsed());
    canvas.save("output.png").unwrap()
}
```


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.63.0-nightly (c52b9c10b 2022-05-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
```
